newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch bourse turnover hits record in January.
newsitem.headline: Dutch bourse turnover hits record in January.

text.p: Total turnover on the Amsterdam Stock Exchange increased by 41.5 percent in January, compared with December, to 215.6 billion guilders, the Exchange said.
Turnover in shares rose 57.4 percent in January, compared to January 1995, to 86.6 billion guilders, setting a new record, the exchange said.
But turnover in bonds fell by 3.2 percent compared to January last year, and amounted to 128.9 billion guilders.
Of the bond turnover on the AEX, trade in state loans totalled 114 billion guilders in January, down four percent from the year ago period.
"The AEX bourse benefitted from the positive impact of rising foreign bourses, a rise in the dollar, and mainly positive company news," the bourse said in a statement.
